Die Super-Ex
programme.desc: My Super Ex-Girlfriend: Directed by Ivan Reitman. With Uma Thurman, Luke Wilson, Anna Faris, Rainn Wilson. When a regular guy dumps a superhero for her neediness, she uses her powers to make his life a living hell." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0465624/","name":"My Super Ex-Girlfriend","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4OTA4OTYyMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzU4NDQzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a regular guy dumps a superhero for her neediness, she uses her powers to make his life a living hell.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0465624/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"aisandler2"},"dateCreated":"2007-07-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stupid, but funny.","reviewBody":"Never had any interest in seeing this movie, but I caught in on HBO on a Sunday afternoon and found myself laughing out loud on multiple occasions. Better than I expected. Worth watching if you're looking for some good light laughs. Luke Wilson is pretty hilarious when he takes a beating, but Rainn Wilson steals every scene he's in, pretty much playing a sex hungry version of Dwight Schrute. Throws some funny twists onto the Super hero/villain dynamic as well. It's a well thought out movie and an interesting take on the superhero genre, but most of the execution is mediocre; in the end some of the jokes work and some don't. 6/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":63311,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2006-11-08","keywords":"superhero,supernatural power,superhero spoof,femme fatale,architect","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"My Super Ex-Girlfriend","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1419247897","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTE5ZThkMTYtZjc2MS00Y2VkLTgxODEtNWRkZWU2NTcwNGRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTE5ZThkMTYtZjc2MS00Y2VkLTgxODEtNWRkZWU2NTcwNGRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000235/","name":"Uma Thurman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005561/","name":"Luke Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0267506/","name":"Anna Faris"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0718645/","name":"Ivan Reitman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142539/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668309/","name":"Don Payne"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: About Schmidt
About Schmidt
programme.desc:
About Schmidt: Directed by Alexander Payne. With Jack Nicholson, Kathy Bates, Hope Davis, Dermot Mulroney. A recently retired man embarks on a journey to his estranged daughter's wedding, only to discover more about himself and life than he ever expected." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0257360/","name":"About Schmidt","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDgxYzgyMGUtYTkxYS00Yzk5LWIwMmItNGIzY2I5ZTE3MmNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk1Njg5NTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A recently retired man embarks on a journey to his estranged daughter's wedding, only to discover more about himself and life than he ever expected.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0257360/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"diane-34"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Life's quirks","reviewBody":"I love Nicolson and I thought his work in this film was as good as any I have seen him do in any of his previous films. My accolades must begin with the writers for creating such a beautiful novel and script-a perfect canvas for the many fine actors in this film upon which they wove their considerable magic. There were no killings, no car chases, no violence of any kind-I'm surprised that Hollywood distributed it.

Such a slice of life-American life with it's many warts-warts that the Americans probably don't even recognize: Winnebagos like moving palaces, freeway monuments to genocide, business that consumes it's workers only to dump them unceremoniously, too much of everything that amounts to emptiness, etc., etc. The novel by Begley, upon which the film was based, illustrated this consumer emptiness brilliantly by the inclusion of the bookends to the film, the sponsorship of the Tanzanian child by Schmidt. The child's material emptiness was contrasted with Schmidt's emotional emptiness in a way America does not recognize much less watch on the screen.

The last part of the movie dealing with the marriage of Schmidt's daughter to a man who came from a diametrically opposite "new age" family was an unstated acknowledgment by his daughter that she wanted nothing of her father's values-she wanted a complete break and she was going to marry the break.

A fascinating, complex movie and I'm sorry I didn't see it much earlier."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":126790,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-04-09","keywords":"minden nebraska,retirement party,recreational vehicle,omaha nebraska,female nudity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"About Schmidt","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3820224793","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzIyMmQyMjUtOWI4Ny00NzZiLWI2NzgtZDQ0YmEzOTk1NTRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzIyMmQyMjUtOWI4Ny00NzZiLWI2NzgtZDQ0YmEzOTk1NTRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from New Line Cinema"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000197/","name":"Jack Nicholson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0204706/","name":"Hope Davis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000551/","name":"Dermot Mulroney"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028247/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1095201/","name":"Louis Begley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852591/","name":"Jim Taylor"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0257360, Title: About Schmidt, --- Description: About Schmidt: Directed by Alexander Payne. With Jack Nicholson, Kathy Bates, Hope Davis, Dermot Mulroney. A recently retired man embarks on a journey to his estranged daughter's wedding, only to discover more about himself and life than he ever expected." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0257360/","name":"About Schmidt","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDgxYzgyMGUtYTkxYS00Yzk5LWIwMmItNGIzY2I5ZTE3MmNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk1Njg5NTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A recently retired man embarks on a journey to his estranged daughter's wedding, only to discover more about himself and life than he ever expected.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0257360/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"diane-34","dateCreated":"2004-09-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Life's quirks","reviewBody":"I love Nicolson and I thought his work in this film was as good as any I have seen him do in any of his previous films. My accolades must begin with the writers for creating such a beautiful novel and script-a perfect canvas for the many fine actors in this film upon which they wove their considerable magic. There were no killings, no car chases, no violence of any kind-I'm surprised that Hollywood distributed it.

Such a slice of life-American life with it's many warts-warts that the Americans probably don't even recognize: Winnebagos like moving palaces, freeway monuments to genocide, business that consumes it's workers only to dump them unceremoniously, too much of everything that amounts to emptiness, etc., etc. The novel by Begley, upon which the film was based, illustrated this consumer emptiness brilliantly by the inclusion of the bookends to the film, the sponsorship of the Tanzanian child by Schmidt. The child's material emptiness was contrasted with Schmidt's emotional emptiness in a way America does not recognize much less watch on the screen.

The last part of the movie dealing with the marriage of Schmidt's daughter to a man who came from a diametrically opposite "new age" family was an unstated acknowledgment by his daughter that she wanted nothing of her father's values-she wanted a complete break and she was going to marry the break.

A fascinating, complex movie and I'm sorry I didn't see it much earlier.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":126790,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-04-09","keywords":"minden nebraska,retirement party,recreational vehicle,omaha nebraska,female nudity","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"About Schmidt","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3820224793","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzIyMmQyMjUtOWI4Ny00NzZiLWI2NzgtZDQ0YmEzOTk1NTRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzIyMmQyMjUtOWI4Ny00NzZiLWI2NzgtZDQ0YmEzOTk1NTRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from New Line Cinema","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000197/","name":"Jack Nicholson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0204706/","name":"Hope Davis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000551/","name":"Dermot Mulroney"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028247/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1095201/","name":"Louis Begley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852591/","name":"Jim Taylor"],"duration":"PT2H5M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Bucket List
Das Beste kommt zum Schluss
programme.desc:
The Bucket List: Directed by Rob Reiner. With Jack Nicholson, Morgan Freeman, Sean Hayes, Beverly Todd. Two terminally ill men escape from a cancer ward and head off on a road trip with a wish list of to-dos before they die." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0825232/","name":"The Bucket List","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2NTUyMjIyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNzYwMDM4._V1_.jpg","description":"Two terminally ill men escape from a cancer ward and head off on a road trip with a wish list of to-dos before they die.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0825232/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jewbearjosh"},"dateCreated":"2008-01-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"heart warming story of friendship-strong male performances","reviewBody":"On new years day, 2008, I saw the film "The Bucket List." It was not my first choice of a film that I wanted to see. To be honest, however, I probably would not have enjoyed any of the films that I would have chosen more. This film is very well done. I liked the screenplay, by Justin Zackham. I liked the direction, by the real talented Rob Reiner. And I was very impressed by the acting. Jack Nicholson and Morgan Freeman did a superb job, playing two dying old guys who befriend each other, and together have the adventure of their lives. The film is very good. The plot involves this hospital owner-Edward Cole-who is dying from cancer, and another cancer victim-Carter Chambers-who meets Cole while getting treatment at the same hospital. After they both find out that they each have only a few months to live, they agree to travel together all over the globe, and follow this list of tasks. They call it the bucket list.

Nicholson gives a real touching performance as Ed Cole. He plays Cole funny, sad, stubborn, angry, strong, fearless, and loud. Morgan gives an equally touching performance as C. Chambers. He plays Chambers smart, cool, romantic, funny, fearless, and emotional. Both men are very moving in this film. They are great sharing the screen. I really enjoyed watching them play scenes together. It was for me a real treat. These guys, Nicholson and Freeman, are two of our finest actors. And this film is no exception.

Even though "The Bucket List" is a small film about friendship, and the meaning of truly living, I do not recommend it for the preteens. There are some very adult scenes. However, families with teenagers will enjoy seeing it together.

Josh Weinman","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":238805,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2008-04-02","keywords":"falling asleep,usa,united states,list,journey","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Bucket List","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3367043353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNDA5MTE2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDQxNzYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNDA5MTE2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDQxNzYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Bucket List - Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000197/","name":"Jack Nicholson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000151/","name":"Morgan Freeman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005003/","name":"Sean Hayes"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001661/","name":"Rob Reiner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0287540/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0188112/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0951698/","name":"Justin Zackham"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Ted 2: Directed by Seth MacFarlane. With Mark Wahlberg, Seth MacFarlane, Amanda Seyfried, Jessica Barth. Newlywed couple Ted and Tami-Lynn want to have a baby, but in order to qualify to be a parent, Ted will have to prove he's a person in a court of law." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2637276/","name":"Ted 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEwMDg3MDk1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjYyODA1NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Newlywed couple Ted and Tami-Lynn want to have a baby, but in order to qualify to be a parent, Ted will have to prove he's a person in a court of law.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2637276/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MR_Heraclius"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ted","reviewBody":"If you're a fan of the first Ted movie you'll probably enjoy the second as well but I think everybody can pretty much agree the first one was a lot funnier. The performances are still decent with some laughs, the biggest problem is is the ho-hum story that isn't engaging. The freshness from the first movie is gone as well. All in all Ted 2 is a slightly fun little comedy if you enjoyed the first one just don't expect it to be as good.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":196660,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-06-26","keywords":"lawyer,fight,scene after end credits,trial,talking teddy bear","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"In Theaters June 26","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2232528921","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzNjM5NjE2N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTU3MTc5NTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzNjM5NjE2N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTU3MTc5NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Ted 2, newlywed couple Ted and Tami-Lynn want to have a baby, but in order to qualify to be a parent, Ted will have to prove he's a person in a court of law."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000242/","name":"Mark Wahlberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532235/","name":"Seth MacFarlane"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1086543/","name":"Amanda Seyfried"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532235/","name":"Seth MacFarlane"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0194736/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065872/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532235/","name":"Seth MacFarlane"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1273148/","name":"Alec Sulkin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1273397/","name":"Wellesley Wild"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fun with Dick and Jane
Dick und Jane – Zu allem bereit, zu nichts zu gebrauchen
programme.desc: Fun with Dick and Jane: Directed by Dean Parisot. With Jim Carrey, Téa Leoni, Alec Baldwin, Richard Jenkins. When an affluent couple lose all their money following a series of blunders, they turn to a life of crime to make ends meet." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0369441/","name":"Fun with Dick and Jane","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTJiMWFiNzgtMDQxZi00NTFiLWE2YjMtNTA5NzY5YzQxZjNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"When an affluent couple lose all their money following a series of blunders, they turn to a life of crime to make ends meet.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0369441/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Smells_Like_Cheese"},"dateCreated":"2006-01-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"I had fun with Dick and Jane","reviewBody":"Well, was this the best Jim Carrey comedy? Not really, but it is one of his better late one's. I think because I have had the week from heck, I just needed a good laugh, thanks to Jim. :) Anywho, Dick and Jane are two average Americans who follow by the rules and manage a reasonable budget. When the company that Dick owns goes broke, he is fired, he and Jane are now in trouble when Dick cannot find a job fast enough. Piece by piece they are loosing or having to sell their stuff, when Dick receives an eviction notice, he and Jane have had it and will no longer play by the rules to live their lives once again. With a cast who seemed to enjoy making the film, I think this was over all a funny movie to watch and would recommend it.\n\n7/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":141335,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2006-02-08","keywords":"head shop,character names in title,forenames in title,ceo,suburb","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Fun with Dick and Jane","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3769106713","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDE1ZDUwODktZmJkZS00Y2Y5LWJkZTItOWE5MGEwMDVmMTdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDE1ZDUwODktZmJkZS00Y2Y5LWJkZTItOWE5MGEwMDVmMTdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000120/","name":"Jim Carrey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000495/","name":"Téa Leoni"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000285/","name":"Alec Baldwin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0661751/","name":"Dean Parisot"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0169347/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831557/","name":"Nicholas Stoller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301416/","name":"Gerald Gaiser"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

When the company that Dick owns goes broke, he is fired, he and Jane are now in trouble when Dick cannot find a job fast enough. Piece by piece they are loosing or having to sell their stuff, when Dick receives an eviction notice, he and Jane have had it and will no longer play by the rules to live their lives once again. With a cast who seemed to enjoy making the film, I think this was over all a funny movie to watch and would recommend it.\n\n7/10","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":141335,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2006-02-08","keywords":"head shop,character names in title,forenames in title,ceo,suburb","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Fun with Dick and Jane","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3769106713","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDE1ZDUwODktZmJkZS00Y2Y5LWJkZTItOWE5MGEwMDVmMTdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDE1ZDUwODktZmJkZS00Y2Y5LWJkZTItOWE5MGEwMDVmMTdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000120/","name":"Jim Carrey","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000495/","name":"Téa Leoni","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000285/","name":"Alec Baldwin"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0661751/","name":"Dean Parisot"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0169347/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831557/","name":"Nicholas Stoller","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301416/","name":"Gerald Gaiser"],"duration":"PT1H30M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bean
Bean – Der ultimative Katastrophenfilm
programme.desc:
Bean: Directed by Mel Smith. With Rowan Atkinson, Peter MacNicol, John Mills, Pamela Reed. The bumbling Mr. Bean travels to America when he is given the responsibility of bringing a highly valuable painting to a Los Angeles museum." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0118689/","name":"Bean","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjU2YzY5NDEtM2M3NC00NGM0LTg3MmItNWQ1OWY2ZmNkZTU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"The bumbling Mr. Bean travels to America when he is given the responsibility of bringing a highly valuable painting to a Los Angeles museum.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0118689/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DVD_Connoisseur"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Average but warm-hearted comedy","reviewBody":""Bean" is the average but warm-hearted, large screen adventure of Rowan Atkinson's bumbling but strangely likable character.

With a smörgåsbord of talent behind this film, there are a few genuine laughs but, sadly, they're few and far between. This film could have been so much better in the hands of another director. Mel Smith appears to have been on cruise-control making this movie. It's a case of comedy by numbers and the film never seems to shift gear.

The always amusing Peter MacNicol is excellent as the suffering David Langley and provides the perfect foil to Atkinson's Bean.

An average comedy movie, it's worth a viewing if there's nothing else on the television."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":101639,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"1997-08-01","keywords":"mr bean character,california,los angeles california,1990s,surname as title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bean","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1186529561","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzllZjYzNGEtZTM3YS00YTBmLTgyM2UtODZhMzQ0OWZhMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzllZjYzNGEtZTM3YS00YTBmLTgyM2UtODZhMzQ0OWZhMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Gramercy Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000100/","name":"Rowan Atkinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001493/","name":"Peter MacNicol"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0590055/","name":"John Mills"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0809321/","name":"Mel Smith"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030612/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103644/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000100/","name":"Rowan Atkinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193485/","name":"Richard Curtis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003741/","name":"Robin Driscoll"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: It Could Happen to You
Zwei Millionen Dollar Trinkgeld
programme.desc:
It Could Happen to You: Directed by Andrew Bergman. With Nicolas Cage, Bridget Fonda, Rosie Perez, Wendell Pierce. A police officer promises to share his lottery ticket with a waitress in lieu of a tip." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0110167/","name":"It Could Happen to You","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzMxOGUzOWEtMGUxMi00ZWM1LWE3ODgtNzc4OGVjZmJhMmFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY0NzcxNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer promises to share his lottery ticket with a waitress in lieu of a tip.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0110167/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"floydianer"},"dateCreated":"2006-02-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"This is how a modern romantic comedy should look like","reviewBody":"If you judge "It Could Happen to you" by its amount of realistic situations and characters, you'll probably give it a 4 out of 10. But, who cares about realism here? It's like a modern fairy tale, Frank Capra transported into the 90s. There's a wonderful storyline (Cop gives waitress a 2 million dollar tip), which apparently is even based on real-life events. Nicolas Cage plays the most honest cop imaginable, and he proves he can play a romantic lead role just as well as a dramatic action/thriller one. His character is not exactly 100 percent realistic, but that's not a problem, this is Hollywood for heaven's sake.

Even better than Cage is his female leading lady: the fascinating Bridget Fonda. Fonda is a wonderful actress who can play both a cute character like her waitress Yvonne here and more challenging roles like the LadyMacBeth-similar one in "A Simple Plan". Unfortunately she never had the career of a Julia Roberts but she is in fact more talented and better looking. Throughout the whole movie she gives a good performance and looks gorgeous. If I had the choice of giving a waitress the lottery money or not and the woman looked like Fonda I might even give it to her. Of course there aren't so many waitresses out there that look (and behave) as charming as her and chances are low I'll ever win two millions in the lottery.

Also notable is the wonderful chemistry between Cage and Fonda. As for the supporting roles special mention has to go to Perez. Although you wonder why Cage married her in the first place, she gives a humorous and entertaining performance. Of course there's kitsch but that's not necessarily bad. Good kitsch can be wonderful and this film, that has an absolutely great happy ending, serves as a perfect example of how a romantic comedy should be filmed. It's better than "Pretty Woman".","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":38148,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1994-07-29","keywords":"hot air balloon,generosity,lottery,waitress,winning the lottery","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"It Could Happen to You","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1269760281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg2MmJjM2ItMTM5Ny00NTBlLTk3ZTQtNzFiOWRhZWNlNDAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg2MmJjM2ItMTM5Ny00NTBlLTk3ZTQtNzFiOWRhZWNlNDAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000403/","name":"Bridget Fonda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001609/","name":"Rosie Perez"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000921/","name":"Andrew Bergman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0026862/","name":"Jane Anderson"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Friends with Benefits
Freunde mit gewissen Vorzügen
programme.desc:
Friends with Benefits: Directed by Will Gluck. With Justin Timberlake, Mila Kunis, Patricia Clarkson, Jenna Elfman. A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1632708/","name":"Friends with Benefits","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2MzQ0NTk4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDc2NDYzNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1632708/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DICK STEEL"},"dateCreated":"2011-10-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Nutshell Review: Friends with Benefits","reviewBody":"2011 will probably go down as the year Hollywood tells us having F* buddies is OK and encouraged, with no less than three films this year set around the premise of pure sex without strings or emotions attached, with Love and Other Drugs and No Strings Attached setting the precedence earlier with an incredibly good looking cast in all sorts of undress - Anne Hathaway, Jake Gyllenhaal, Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher - and added to the list will be current IT guy and girl Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis rolling beneath the sheets in a typical love story between the emotionally unavailable and the emotionally damaged.

Mila Kunis stars as Jamie, a headhunter in New York who persuades her target Dylan played by Justin Timberlake to ditch his young, upstart blogging team to join GQ (how's that for a little bit of subtle advertising) in revamping its website and to infuse new content ideas. A night out prior to the offer seals the LA based Dylan to relocate and take up the offer, with plenty of activities thrown in that if it's not Jamie being his only friend in a new, big city, they would serve as activities that would fit in for an awesome date night out. Before long they become firm friends, and made a pact to keep things physical since they each have their wants, and with the other party game to get down and dirty, so begins their game of tennis (though personally I prefer analogy with, and the term "bedminton" - it involves cocks after all). After all, why complicate what would be a beautiful friendship, if sex can be treated just as sex without the emotions thrown in to mess things up?

You know the clichéd drill by now, with things moving along fine and dandy, the hint of emotions coming into play to really turn things upside down, the narrative montage to show how frequent they mate like jackrabbits, before some large, needy episode or statements uttered that will probably reveal the true state of affairs, and the list goes on. Deny all you want, but one cannot help but to agree that the fairer sex will have things rough if pacts of this nature turn sour, and expectedly in a movie they always do, otherwise everyone will be happy without adversary, frustration and challenges to overcome and provide that change in strength of character.

And it is this power of the cliché that absolutely calls the shots in films like these. You know what will happen, but want to see them happen anyway even though you're multiple steps ahead of every character. And it is precisely these expectations that anyone would want to see covered, and try as the filmmakers want it is the clichés that they find hard to break away from, even if characters here proclaim very early on that romance in their world shouldn't be like an unbelievable Hollywood film, but in what would be art imitating art, look who's talking to begin with. And what's with the fixation about consistently taking the shine off the captain of US Airways Flight 1549 in its emergency landing onto the Hudson River?

Justin Timberlake is fast becoming the busy bona fide movie star since The Social Network, and continues his run with this film and In Time which will hit the screens here soon. He has that boyish charm that the camera just loves, and being a real life singer meant covering a number of songs here, from Stereophonics to Kris Kross made it look all too easy. Mila Kunis plays her role as the emotionally damaged girl with aplomb, and shares an effective chemistry with Timberlake that makes this film a delight to sit through, even if as mentioned the story's cliché and we know just about how these two nice looking people will likely get together. 

The supporting characters while one dimensional almost always threaten to steal the show, from Patricia Clarkson as Jamie's sex crazed mom extending the lifespan of a running joke involving the nationality of Jamie's unseen dad, Woody Harrelson as the gay colleague of Dylan who always have innuendos offhand to share, Jenna Elfman who plays Dylan's sister and Richard Jenkins starring as Dylan's dad who's suffering from advancing Alzheimer's disease, which is especially poignant as it deals with the subplot of how a family copes with a loved one who's behaviour develops erratically, and holding the key to a pivotal personal experience to share and turn things around.

With Andy Samberg and Emma Stone making cameos (the latter being extremely crazy as a fanatical John Meyer fan), Friends With Benefits has its main leads to thank for in milking quite the cliché story for the masses, who are likely to make a beeline just to see those two in some down and dirty action, not that you get to see a lot to begin with anyway. Recommended, and stay tuned until after the end credits roll for more commentary when the two are sitting at a couch watching the outtakes of a DVD movie."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":353653,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-07-22","keywords":"female rear nudity,blow job,no panties,oral sex,scantily clad female","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2190056729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The relationship between two friends (Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis) gets complicated when they decide to get romantic. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005109/","name":"Mila Kunis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005493/","name":"Justin Timberlake"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0165101/","name":"Patricia Clarkson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0323239/","name":"Will Gluck"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010568/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0110404/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2226647/","name":"Keith Merryman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2226970/","name":"David A. Newman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0323239/","name":"Will Gluck"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1632708, Title: Friends with Benefits, --- Description: Friends with Benefits: Directed by Will Gluck. With Justin Timberlake, Mila Kunis, Patricia Clarkson, Jenna Elfman. A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1632708/","name":"Friends with Benefits","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2MzQ0NTk4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDc2NDYzNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1632708/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"DICK STEEL","dateCreated":"2011-10-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Nutshell Review: Friends with Benefits","reviewBody":"2011 will probably go down as the year Hollywood tells us having F* buddies is OK and encouraged, with no less than three films this year set around the premise of pure sex without strings or emotions attached, with Love and Other Drugs and No Strings Attached setting the precedence earlier with an incredibly good looking cast in all sorts of undress - Anne Hathaway, Jake Gyllenhaal, Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher - and added to the list will be current IT guy and girl Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis rolling beneath the sheets in a typical love story between the emotionally unavailable and the emotionally damaged.

Mila Kunis stars as Jamie, a headhunter in New York who persuades her target Dylan played by Justin Timberlake to ditch his young, upstart blogging team to join GQ (how's that for a little bit of subtle advertising) in revamping its website and to infuse new content ideas. A night out prior to the offer seals the LA based Dylan to relocate and take up the offer, with plenty of activities thrown in that if it's not Jamie being his only friend in a new, big city, they would serve as activities that would fit in for an awesome date night out. Before long they become firm friends, and made a pact to keep things physical since they each have their wants, and with the other party game to get down and dirty, so begins their game of tennis (though personally I prefer analogy with, and the term "bedminton" - it involves cocks after all). After all, why complicate what would be a beautiful friendship, if sex can be treated just as sex without the emotions thrown in to mess things up?

You know the clichéd drill by now, with things moving along fine and dandy, the hint of emotions coming into play to really turn things upside down, the narrative montage to show how frequent they mate like jackrabbits, before some large, needy episode or statements uttered that will probably reveal the true state of affairs, and the list goes on. Deny all you want, but one cannot help but to agree that the fairer sex will have things rough if pacts of this nature turn sour, and expectedly in a movie they always do, otherwise everyone will be happy without adversary, frustration and challenges to overcome and provide that change in strength of character.

And it is this power of the cliché that absolutely calls the shots in films like these. You know what will happen, but want to see them happen anyway even though you're multiple steps ahead of every character. And it is precisely these expectations that anyone would want to see covered, and try as the filmmakers want it is the clichés that they find hard to break away from, even if characters here proclaim very early on that romance in their world shouldn't be like an unbelievable Hollywood film, but in what would be art imitating art, look who's talking to begin with. And what's with the fixation about consistently taking the shine off the captain of US Airways Flight 1549 in its emergency landing onto the Hudson River?

Justin Timberlake is fast becoming the busy bona fide movie star since The Social Network, and continues his run with this film and In Time which will hit the screens here soon. He has that boyish charm that the camera just loves, and being a real life singer meant covering a number of songs here, from Stereophonics to Kris Kross made it look all too easy. Mila Kunis plays her role as the emotionally damaged girl with aplomb, and shares an effective chemistry with Timberlake that makes this film a delight to sit through, even if as mentioned the story's cliché and we know just about how these two nice looking people will likely get together. 

The supporting characters while one dimensional almost always threaten to steal the show, from Patricia Clarkson as Jamie's sex crazed mom extending the lifespan of a running joke involving the nationality of Jamie's unseen dad, Woody Harrelson as the gay colleague of Dylan who always have innuendos offhand to share, Jenna Elfman who plays Dylan's sister and Richard Jenkins starring as Dylan's dad who's suffering from advancing Alzheimer's disease, which is especially poignant as it deals with the subplot of how a family copes with a loved one who's behaviour develops erratically, and holding the key to a pivotal personal experience to share and turn things around.

With Andy Samberg and Emma Stone making cameos (the latter being extremely crazy as a fanatical John Meyer fan), Friends With Benefits has its main leads to thank for in milking quite the cliché story for the masses, who are likely to make a beeline just to see those two in some down and dirty action, not that you get to see a lot to begin with anyway. Recommended, and stay tuned until after the end credits roll for more commentary when the two are sitting at a couch watching the outtakes of a DVD movie.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":353653,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-07-22","keywords":"female rear nudity,blow job,no panties,oral sex,scantily clad female","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2190056729","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The relationship between two friends (Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis) gets complicated when they decide to get romantic. The story is kinda predictable and the plot is a bit lame and corny but the movie is worthy because of its cast. Actors like Alec Baldwin and Steve Maritn and an actress like Meryl Streep make it a real joy. Their performances are excellent and so funny. programme.title: 24x36: A Movie About Movie Posters
24x36: A Movie About Movie Posters
programme.desc:
24x36: A Movie About Movie Posters: Directed by Kevin Burke. With Paul Ainsworth, Dave Alexander, Andrea Alvin, David Byrd. A documentary exploring the birth, death, and resurrection of the illustrated movie poster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5003654/","name":"24x36: A Movie About Movie Posters","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjAyOTk1NDUxNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjg4NzgwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A documentary exploring the birth, death, and resurrection of the illustrated movie poster.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5003654/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gavin6942"},"dateCreated":"2016-11-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Finally A Film About A Little-Known Area of Film","reviewBody":"A documentary exploring the birth, death, and resurrection of the illustrated movie poster.

Early on, the film tells us a great truth: posters are often more iconic than any one scene of a movie. "Jaws" comes to mind, as do others, where it is the poster that has become the popular image. And yet, do any of these names sound familiar: John Alvin (1948-2008), Bob Peak (1927-1992), Reynold Brown (1917-1991), Richard Amsel (1947-1985), Drew Struzan (b. 1947). Probably not, though they were the giants of the poster art world.

The studios saw the posters as advertising, not art. And while that is true in the strictest sense, it left many great artists unappreciated. More often than not, no signatures were allowed on the posters, and the work from the earliest years in now anonymous. Who painted the great posters of Frankenstein's monster? We will never know.

As anyone who lived through the 1980s-1990s knows, in the late 80s, there was a shift to photography, with the idea that artistic posters might suggest an animated film. This claim that pops up again and again, and sounds absurd on its face, but one scene actually has a focus group looking at posters and making the exact same comment.

The "art" in poster art took a dive in the 1990s, leaving us with "floating heads" and the same layout was used over and over again. For horror fans, this was evident in the teen horror films ("Scream", "Last Summer") and has not really stopped. Even the more creative posters today seem to rehash the same poses and images over and over and over. Is poster art dead? No. Because "24x36" covers a longer history, a new trend. Not just the history of lithographs and the decline of posters, but its new resurgence thanks to the rise of Mondo, its eccentric leader Rob Jones, and the new art from specialty Blu-ray labels like Scream Factory and Arrow Video. And this generation of artists, such as Gary Pulling, are not anonymous.

"24x36" is a much-needed piece of film history. There are many biopics, and there have been focuses on the special effects. Those behind the scenes are finally getting their due. But what of the painters and sketch artists who really drove the images into our collective, pop culture imagination? Now their story can be told!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":771,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"genre":["Documentary","Biography","History"],"datePublished":"2017-07-11","keywords":"2010s,poster,film poster,film advertising material,ephemera","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2598287641","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDZiMWYzYTItMzE1Mi00OGJjLWFmYjctZTIwNDdjMTc0ZmZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDZiMWYzYTItMzE1Mi00OGJjLWFmYjctZTIwNDdjMTc0ZmZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Explores the birth, death and recent resurrection of illustrated movie poster art. Through interviews with key art personalities from the past four decades, director Kevin Burke's film aims to answer the question: What happened to the illustrated movie poster, why did it disappear, and what's brought it back?"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7636417/","name":"Paul Ainsworth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3543880/","name":"Dave Alexander"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1646705/","name":"Andrea Alvin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7636418/","name":"Kevin Burke"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0308847/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0579009/"}],"duration":"PT1H22M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 5003654, Title: 24x36: A Movie About Movie Posters, --- Description: 24x36: A Movie About Movie Posters: Directed by Kevin Burke. With Paul Ainsworth, Dave Alexander, Andrea Alvin, David Byrd. A documentary exploring the birth, death, and resurrection of the illustrated movie poster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5003654/","name":"24x36: A Movie About Movie Posters","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjAyOTk1NDUxNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjg4NzgwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A documentary exploring the birth, death, and resurrection of the illustrated movie poster.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5003654/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"gavin6942","dateCreated":"2016-11-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Finally A Film About A Little-Known Area of Film","reviewBody":"A documentary exploring the birth, death, and resurrection of the illustrated movie poster.

Early on, the film tells us a great truth: posters are often more iconic than any one scene of a movie. "Jaws" comes to mind, as do others, where it is the poster that has become the popular image. And yet, do any of these names sound familiar: John Alvin (1948-2008), Bob Peak (1927-1992), Reynold Brown (1917-1991), Richard Amsel (1947-1985), Drew Struzan (b. 1947). Probably not, though they were the giants of the poster art world.

The studios saw the posters as advertising, not art. And while that is true in the strictest sense, it left many great artists unappreciated. More often than not, no signatures were allowed on the posters, and the work from the earliest years in now anonymous. Who painted the great posters of Frankenstein's monster? We will never know.

As anyone who lived through the 1980s-1990s knows, in the late 80s, there was a shift to photography, with the idea that artistic posters might suggest an animated film. This claim that pops up again and again, and sounds absurd on its face, but one scene actually has a focus group looking at posters and making the exact same comment.

The "art" in poster art took a dive in the 1990s, leaving us with "floating heads" and the same layout was used over and over again. For horror fans, this was evident in the teen horror films ("Scream", "Last Summer") and has not really stopped. Even the more creative posters today seem to rehash the same poses and images over and over and over. Is poster art dead? No. Because "24x36" covers a longer history, a new trend. Not just the history of lithographs and the decline of posters, but its new resurgence thanks to the rise of Mondo, its eccentric leader Rob Jones, and the new art from specialty Blu-ray labels like Scream Factory and Arrow Video. And this generation of artists, such as Gary Pulling, are not anonymous.

"24x36" is a much-needed piece of film history. There are many biopics, and there have been focuses on the special effects. Those behind the scenes are finally getting their due. But what of the painters and sketch artists who really drove the images into our collective, pop culture imagination? Now their story can be told!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":771,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6,"genre":["Documentary","Biography","History"],"datePublished":"2017-07-11","keywords":"2010s,poster,film poster,film advertising material,ephemera","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2598287641","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDZiMWYzYTItMzE1Mi00OGJjLWFmYjctZTIwNDdjMTc0ZmZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDZiMWYzYTItMzE1Mi00OGJjLWFmYjctZTIwNDdjMTc0ZmZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Explores the birth, death and recent resurrection of illustrated movie poster art. Through interviews with key art personalities from the past four decades, director Kevin Burke's film aims to answer the question: What happened to the illustrated movie poster, why did it disappear, and what's brought it back?","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7636417/","name":"Paul Ainsworth","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3543880/","name":"Dave Alexander","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1646705/","name":"Andrea Alvin"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7636418/","name":"Kevin Burke"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0308847/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0579009/"],"duration":"PT1H22M"</script><metacontent="

On the run in the year 1987, Bumblebee finds refuge in a junkyard in a small California beach town. On the cusp of turning 18 and trying to find her place in the world, Charlie Watson discovers Bumblebee, battle-scarred and broken." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4701182/","name":"Bumblebee","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjUwNjU5NDMyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzgxNjM2NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"On the run in the year 1987, Bumblebee finds refuge in a junkyard in a small California beach town. On the cusp of turning 18 and trying to find her place in the world, Charlie Watson discovers Bumblebee, battle-scarred and broken.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4701182/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kevinxirau"},"dateCreated":"2018-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Finally the Transformers movie we deserve.","reviewBody":"In 2007, Michael Bay showed the world that today's technology could bring the famed Transformers to life on the big screen. Sadly, he has the finesse of a brick to the face as his subsequent films for the most part are rusted pieces of scrap due to his crude style of filmmaking, lack of focus, and narrow demographic, leaving fans with only the 80s animated movie as the true "good one", that is until now.

Plot: Charlie Watson (Hailee Steinfeld), a teen girl struggling to move on after her father's untimely death, encounters the fugitive Autobot Bumblebee and the two form a heartfelt bond, which will be tested as they are hunted by both the secretive Sector 7 and a couple of Decepticons.

Knight knows what makes a film truly stick with people and that is in the story and how one tells it, something he excels at. He gives his films heart, thus the relationship between Charlie and Bumblebee feels natural. The central focus is this friendship with many scenes that are charming, funny, and hit hard in the feels. Unlike the stuttering and super uptight Sam Witwicky, Charlie has a lot of spunk and pathos. While having a predictable character arc, John Cena did a nice job with his role. I love that this film is not only set in the 80s (when the show came out), but lives and breathes pop cultural references and classic songs from that era (including a great callback to Stan Bush). While Bay's action focuses on huge zany explosion-fests that push believability and heavily involve the human military, here the action is smaller and much more personal, strictly Autobot vs Decepticon as it should be since it was what the franchise was built on. In fact, the portrayal of the Decepticons has improved; not only can I tell them apart this time thanks to their varied designs and color schemes, but they're given more personality and actually live up to their name.

The only thing that has me puzzled is the continuity as there's confusion over whether or not this is a reboot or a prequel given some conflicting elements. That being said, this is, in many ways, the Transformers movie I've been itching to see for a long time. I'd like to see more directors present their takes on the franchise and go to places both familiar and new as long as Bay stays out of the directing chair. To sum it up, Bumblebee's got the Touch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":152675,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2018-12-21","keywords":"prequel,transformer robot,bumblebee the autobot,birthday,spin off","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"In Theaters Thursday","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1473100313","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlNmI5MDQtMmU4ZS00ZTcwLTkwMjUtNzY2NmY0ZWUzMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlNmI5MDQtMmU4ZS00ZTcwLTkwMjUtNzY2NmY0ZWUzMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2794962/","name":"Hailee Steinfeld"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7449863/","name":"Jorge Lendeborg Jr."},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1078479/","name":"John Cena"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1325899/","name":"Travis Knight"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0130376/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0562497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0117723/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5429637/","name":"Christina Hodson"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

On the run in the year 1987, Bumblebee finds refuge in a junkyard in a small California beach town. On the cusp of turning 18 and trying to find her place in the world, Charlie Watson discovers Bumblebee, battle-scarred and broken." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4701182/","name":"Bumblebee","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjUwNjU5NDMyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzgxNjM2NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"On the run in the year 1987, Bumblebee finds refuge in a junkyard in a small California beach town. On the cusp of turning 18 and trying to find her place in the world, Charlie Watson discovers Bumblebee, battle-scarred and broken.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4701182/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"kevinxirau","dateCreated":"2018-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Finally the Transformers movie we deserve.","reviewBody":"In 2007, Michael Bay showed the world that today's technology could bring the famed Transformers to life on the big screen. Sadly, he has the finesse of a brick to the face as his subsequent films for the most part are rusted pieces of scrap due to his crude style of filmmaking, lack of focus, and narrow demographic, leaving fans with only the 80s animated movie as the true "good one", that is until now.

Plot: Charlie Watson (Hailee Steinfeld), a teen girl struggling to move on after her father's untimely death, encounters the fugitive Autobot Bumblebee and the two form a heartfelt bond, which will be tested as they are hunted by both the secretive Sector 7 and a couple of Decepticons.

Knight knows what makes a film truly stick with people and that is in the story and how one tells it, something he excels at. He gives his films heart, thus the relationship between Charlie and Bumblebee feels natural. The central focus is this friendship with many scenes that are charming, funny, and hit hard in the feels. Unlike the stuttering and super uptight Sam Witwicky, Charlie has a lot of spunk and pathos. While having a predictable character arc, John Cena did a nice job with his role. I love that this film is not only set in the 80s (when the show came out), but lives and breathes pop cultural references and classic songs from that era (including a great callback to Stan Bush). While Bay's action focuses on huge zany explosion-fests that push believability and heavily involve the human military, here the action is smaller and much more personal, strictly Autobot vs Decepticon as it should be since it was what the franchise was built on. In fact, the portrayal of the Decepticons has improved; not only can I tell them apart this time thanks to their varied designs and color schemes, but they're given more personality and actually live up to their name.

The only thing that has me puzzled is the continuity as there's confusion over whether or not this is a reboot or a prequel given some conflicting elements. That being said, this is, in many ways, the Transformers movie I've been itching to see for a long time. I'd like to see more directors present their takes on the franchise and go to places both familiar and new as long as Bay stays out of the directing chair. To sum it up, Bumblebee's got the Touch.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":152675,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2018-12-21","keywords":"prequel,transformer robot,bumblebee the autobot,birthday,spin off","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"In Theaters Thursday","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1473100313","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlNmI5MDQtMmU4ZS00ZTcwLTkwMjUtNzY2NmY0ZWUzMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlNmI5MDQtMmU4ZS00ZTcwLTkwMjUtNzY2NmY0ZWUzMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2794962/","name":"Hailee Steinfeld","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7449863/","name":"Jorge Lendeborg Jr.","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1078479/","name":"John Cena"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1325899/","name":"Travis Knight"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0130376/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0562497/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0117723/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5429637/","name":"Christina Hodson"],"duration":"PT1H54M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
Transformers 3 – Die dunkle Seite des Mondes
programme.desc:
Transformers: Dark of the Moon: Directed by Michael Bay. With Shia LaBeouf, Rosie Huntington-Whiteley, Josh Duhamel, John Turturro. The Autobots learn of a Cybertronian spacecraft hidden on the moon, and race against the Decepticons to reach it and to learn its secrets." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1399103/","name":"Transformers: Dark of the Moon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkwOTY0MTc1NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDQwNjA2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Autobots learn of a Cybertronian spacecraft hidden on the moon, and race against the Decepticons to reach it and to learn its secrets.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1399103/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gavin-thelordofthefu-48-460297"},"dateCreated":"2013-11-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"A bit of an improvement over ROTF, but not nearly as good as the first","reviewBody":"In order to coincide with a fourth Transformers coming out in the next few months, I'll be reviewing this third entry of the successful film series. I liked the first Transformers despite it's cheesy dialog in some parts and while there were some awkward moments and very bad dialog, I still liked Revenge of the Fallen. Then, when I saw the whole thing in theaters back at 2011, I thought, this wasn't so bad after all. It later turned out to be a good ride, but while I do think it's a bit of an improvement over the previous film, it's nowhere near as good as the first.

First, there are some good things that saved the film for me. The music score from Steve Jablonsky has improved and has an epic tone to it. The story is a lot more decent than the previous film with a much better second and third halves; the action sequences are solid especially the collapsing building scene which took my very breath away. The scenery is great and the special effects are as top-notch as ever. The acting is good, too. While John Turturo, Franches McDormand, and John Malkovich aren't given much to do, they did fine with the material. Patrick Dempsey did OK as the villain, but he's a bit underwhelming. Rosie Hunter Whiteley is a bit bland, but not exactly terrible as the new girlfriend for Sam Witwicky. While Shia LeBeouf isn't as charismatic as he was in the first film, he does have the same charm he brought to the film series so far. The Autobots and Decepticons are great to see again and the voice actors are solid especially Leonard Nimoy as Sentinal Prime, who is a very good villain for the movie much Megatron.

Then, there are the bad things that I would point out. First, the script. While the second and third halves are a lot better, the first half is pretty boring. It seems to be lacking in it's action and it wasn't exciting. Second, the ending is way too similar to the first Transformers (what? with the auto-bots and decepticons fight against each other while bringing destruction to the city and such?) The pacing is also very sluggish it would almost put you to sleep. Third and mostly the final problem is the dialog. There are some humorous bits that might get the audience a chuckle, but there are other parts that are just so inane it would give you a headache.

Overall, Transformers: DOTM isn't nearly as good as the first, but despite the flaws that I just stated, I think this is a great sequel in an overall solid franchise. I may not be a fan of Michael Bay and such, but while I do not like the Bad Boys films, Pearl Harbor, and others, I think that this and the other films are a lot better and it deserves a recommendation to those who haven't seen it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":395947,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2011-06-29","keywords":"job interview,year 1969,optimus prime character,robert f. kennedy character,megatron character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #3","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi543989017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYyOTgwOTExOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDQ0NzcyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYyOTgwOTExOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDQ0NzcyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Autobots learn of a Cybertronian spacecraft hidden on the Moon, and race against the Decepticons to reach it and learn its secrets, which could turn the tide in the Transformers' final battle."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0479471/","name":"Shia LaBeouf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2492819/","name":"Rosie Huntington-Whiteley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0879085/","name":"Tyrese Gibson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000881/","name":"Michael Bay"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040938/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0130376/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0472567/","name":"Ehren Kruger"}],"duration":"PT2H34M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1399103, Title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon, --- Description: Transformers: Dark of the Moon: Directed by Michael Bay. With Shia LaBeouf, Rosie Huntington-Whiteley, Josh Duhamel, John Turturro. The Autobots learn of a Cybertronian spacecraft hidden on the moon, and race against the Decepticons to reach it and to learn its secrets." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1399103/","name":"Transformers: Dark of the Moon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkwOTY0MTc1NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDQwNjA2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Autobots learn of a Cybertronian spacecraft hidden on the moon, and race against the Decepticons to reach it and to learn its secrets.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1399103/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"gavin-thelordofthefu-48-460297","dateCreated":"2013-11-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"A bit of an improvement over ROTF, but not nearly as good as the first","reviewBody":"In order to coincide with a fourth Transformers coming out in the next few months, I'll be reviewing this third entry of the successful film series. I liked the first Transformers despite it's cheesy dialog in some parts and while there were some awkward moments and very bad dialog, I still liked Revenge of the Fallen. Then, when I saw the whole thing in theaters back at 2011, I thought, this wasn't so bad after all. It later turned out to be a good ride, but while I do think it's a bit of an improvement over the previous film, it's nowhere near as good as the first.

First, there are some good things that saved the film for me. The music score from Steve Jablonsky has improved and has an epic tone to it. The story is a lot more decent than the previous film with a much better second and third halves; the action sequences are solid especially the collapsing building scene which took my very breath away. The scenery is great and the special effects are as top-notch as ever. The acting is good, too. While John Turturo, Franches McDormand, and John Malkovich aren't given much to do, they did fine with the material. Patrick Dempsey did OK as the villain, but he's a bit underwhelming. Rosie Hunter Whiteley is a bit bland, but not exactly terrible as the new girlfriend for Sam Witwicky. While Shia LeBeouf isn't as charismatic as he was in the first film, he does have the same charm he brought to the film series so far. The Autobots and Decepticons are great to see again and the voice actors are solid especially Leonard Nimoy as Sentinal Prime, who is a very good villain for the movie much Megatron.

Then, there are the bad things that I would point out. First, the script. While the second and third halves are a lot better, the first half is pretty boring. It seems to be lacking in it's action and it wasn't exciting. Second, the ending is way too similar to the first Transformers (what? with the auto-bots and decepticons fight against each other while bringing destruction to the city and such?) The pacing is also very sluggish it would almost put you to sleep. Third and mostly the final problem is the dialog. There are some humorous bits that might get the audience a chuckle, but there are other parts that are just so inane it would give you a headache.

Overall, Transformers: DOTM isn't nearly as good as the first, but despite the flaws that I just stated, I think this is a great sequel in an overall solid franchise. I may not be a fan of Michael Bay and such, but while I do not like the Bad Boys films, Pearl Harbor, and others, I think that this and the other films are a lot better and it deserves a recommendation to those who haven't seen it.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":395947,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2011-06-29","keywords":"job interview,year 1969,optimus prime character,robert f. kennedy character,megatron character","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #3","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi543989017","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYyOTgwOTExOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDQ0NzcyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYyOTgwOTExOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDQ0NzcyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Autobots learn of a Cybertronian spacecraft hidden on the Moon, and race against the Decepticons to reach it and learn its secrets, which could turn the tide in the Transformers' final battle.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0479471/","name":"Shia LaBeouf","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2492819/","name":"Rosie Huntington-Whiteley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0879085/","name":"Tyrese Gibson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000881/","name":"Michael Bay"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040938/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0130376/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0472567/","name":"Ehren Kruger"],"duration":"PT2H34M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bumblebee
Bumblebee
programme.desc:
Bumblebee: Directed by Travis Knight. With Hailee Steinfeld, Jorge Lendeborg Jr., John Cena, Jason Drucker. On the run in the year 1987, Bumblebee finds refuge in a junkyard in a small California beach town. On the cusp of turning 18 and trying to find her place in the world, Charlie Watson discovers Bumblebee, battle-scarred and broken." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4701182/","name":"Bumblebee","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjUwNjU5NDMyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzgxNjM2NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"On the run in the year 1987, Bumblebee finds refuge in a junkyard in a small California beach town. On the cusp of turning 18 and trying to find her place in the world, Charlie Watson discovers Bumblebee, battle-scarred and broken.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4701182/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kevinxirau"},"dateCreated":"2018-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Finally the Transformers movie we deserve.","reviewBody":"In 2007, Michael Bay showed the world that today's technology could bring the famed Transformers to life on the big screen. Sadly, he has the finesse of a brick to the face as his subsequent films for the most part are rusted pieces of scrap due to his crude style of filmmaking, lack of focus, and narrow demographic, leaving fans with only the 80s animated movie as the true "good one", that is until now.

Plot: Charlie Watson (Hailee Steinfeld), a teen girl struggling to move on after her father's untimely death, encounters the fugitive Autobot Bumblebee and the two form a heartfelt bond, which will be tested as they are hunted by both the secretive Sector 7 and a couple of Decepticons.

Knight knows what makes a film truly stick with people and that is in the story and how one tells it, something he excels at. He gives his films heart, thus the relationship between Charlie and Bumblebee feels natural. The central focus is this friendship with many scenes that are charming, funny, and hit hard in the feels. Unlike the stuttering and super uptight Sam Witwicky, Charlie has a lot of spunk and pathos. While having a predictable character arc, John Cena did a nice job with his role. I love that this film is not only set in the 80s (when the show came out), but lives and breathes pop cultural references and classic songs from that era (including a great callback to Stan Bush). While Bay's action focuses on huge zany explosion-fests that push believability and heavily involve the human military, here the action is smaller and much more personal, strictly Autobot vs Decepticon as it should be since it was what the franchise was built on. In fact, the portrayal of the Decepticons has improved; not only can I tell them apart this time thanks to their varied designs and color schemes, but they're given more personality and actually live up to their name.

The only thing that has me puzzled is the continuity as there's confusion over whether or not this is a reboot or a prequel given some conflicting elements. That being said, this is, in many ways, the Transformers movie I've been itching to see for a long time. I'd like to see more directors present their takes on the franchise and go to places both familiar and new as long as Bay stays out of the directing chair. To sum it up, Bumblebee's got the Touch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":152675,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2018-12-21","keywords":"prequel,transformer robot,bumblebee the autobot,birthday,spin off","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"In Theaters Thursday","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1473100313","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlNmI5MDQtMmU4ZS00ZTcwLTkwMjUtNzY2NmY0ZWUzMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlNmI5MDQtMmU4ZS00ZTcwLTkwMjUtNzY2NmY0ZWUzMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2794962/","name":"Hailee Steinfeld"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7449863/","name":"Jorge Lendeborg Jr."},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1078479/","name":"John Cena"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1325899/","name":"Travis Knight"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0130376/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0562497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0117723/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5429637/","name":"Christina Hodson"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="
